to say but blackberry looks like a
classic b-school case study in what
management types call commitment
escalation due when you hang on to an
idea for so long to fail to see that the
world around you is changing its what
clay Christensen at Harvard called the
innovators dilemma companies put too
much emphasis on what their customers
want today and miss what the want
tomorrow they focus on their product
rather than listen to their market
changing think about it this way I'll
give you three examples the typewriter
has greatly influenced the business

nation smith-corona thought it was in

print a sheet of stamps on demand
